name: Four Points by Sheraton Sydney, Darling Harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Took a group of 22 for a business conference in Sydney.
reviews.title: Greta Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel excellent location easy walk to Darling Harbour via foot bridge and easy access to other areas by train or Taxi
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worked out bery well.
reviews.title: Lovely view and comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in October,2006 with my wife and our parents to have a marriage ceremony and honeymoon. Location is good. This hotel is nearby Daring Harbor and Sydney aquarium. And you can walk to Sydney Tower. But if you want to go to Opera house or Harbor biridge, you have to use taxi or bus.Our room was on the first floor. At first,I was disappointed because our room wasn't on upper floor. But the view from the room was decent beautiful in the night. We can look over the opposite shore and there were some glittering hotels. Neons were sparkling.
reviews.title: Fancy hotel with superb location and staff

likes.liked: — The friendliness of the staff, the massive bed and the free upgrade.
likes.disliked: — Speak to Tony on the front desk outside for the best travel tips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a marriage ceremony in Sydney.After finishing the ceremony,we returned to the hotel still wearing wedding clothes. Some staffs congratulated us. We had a good feeling. Generally,this hotel is good hotel. Staffs were very polite and friendly. The Hotel itself is not so big.But room and bed are clean and large. But maybe little expensive,perhaps.
reviews.title: Loved It! --Orange County, CA, USA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a Harbour View room wich is the best place to be in that hotel. The room was not very clean when we arrived and I went to the reception to complaint. When we returned from our walk outside, the room had been cleaned and the hotel had put a good bottle of wine on ice in the room to excuse themselves for the situation. It was nice and not expected. Breakfeast buffet is expansive but really good. Lot of business customers and japanse tourists in the hotel. Room are not silent proof and you can hear next room shower from yours. Overall I recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - great view -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a harbour view room which is have excellent views of darling harbour (the city view rooms seem to look directly onto an office block across the street)
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was fairly large with TV, mini bar, safe, the best blackout curtains in the world! We were room only so didn’t really use the facilities except the first night where we had some food and a few beers at the attached Dundee Arms Pub. Pretty good beer and better than the usual hotel Pub efforts
reviews.title: Four Points, Average Points

likes.liked: — Beautiful view of the Sydney Harbor.
likes.disliked: — Great location for sightseeing and shopping at City Center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is directly behind the Aquarium and Darling Harbour. Plenty of bars and restaurants here to have breakfast and dinner. On the far side of the Aquarium there is a ferry stop that takes you to the city centre. However, ferries here are not that frequent and stop early, rubbish if you want a night out in the city. You can walk this in 20 mins. Despite some guides, this is a aus$40 taxi ride to the airport.
reviews.title: Not a hotel for leisure clients

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought this was a pretty good hotel if slightly out of the main city areas but I would probably stay here again.
reviews.title: Big bed, tiny room in this soul-less, ex Japanese owned hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights and thought the location was excellent. It's 20 minutes walk to the Sydney Opera House and 5-10 minutes walk to where the main shops are. The room we had was lovely with a balcony overlooking Darling Harbour. I would recommend this hotel providing you get a harbour view.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its all about the location
reviews.title: Location,Location,Location

likes.disliked: — The hotel is really well placed to be able to cover a lot of tourist attractions on foot,so walk!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 6 nights October end November first week.Cant find any fault with the hotel itself..were on our honeymoon and after a 11 hour flight, reached the hotel to find our room ready and surprise surprise,we were upgraded to a harbour view room with a bottle of bubbly and chocolates.
reviews.title: Four points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: coming to the most important plus for the hotel-the location is fantastic...exactly a 2 minute walk from the hotel entrance to Darling Harbour and cockel bay wharf the most happening area of Sydney.
reviews.title: good hotel. great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you get this hotel at a good price go for it,good rooms,good bathrooms and a great location.
reviews.title: I feel redundant saying this hotel is in a great location, but it's true!

likes.liked: — The view, the price, the location, the whole package was great!
likes.disliked: — Parking was expensive, but what downtown hotel in any large city doesn't have expensive parking?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the four points on our tour of oz, for two nights on the start of our hols. and was most impressed with the rooms,staff , and on our final leg we stayed for another two nights this time being upgraded to a bayside view which was beaufiful it has easy access to the harbour and is very nice for a walk ,and plenty of restraunts for every taste
reviews.title: very impressed with the four points

likes.liked: — on the second leg the bayside view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006
reviews.text: Quite impressed for a 4 Star Hotel. The rooms are modern, clean and the bed is very very comfortable. You can tell it is not 5 star in the bathroom because the bath and shower are pretty basic. Harbour view is fantastic. All staff were professional and efficient. Didn't try the hotel restaurants or bar because they looked pretty tacky. Many better places to try outside.
reviews.title: Pretty Good for a 4 Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. We booked a Darling Harbour view room and were not disappointed. The view was wonderful. The room was nicely decorated. It was a lot smaller than we had expected and the noise from adjoining room showers and the hall noise was louder than we have experienced in good hotels. The staff were professional...but not friendly. However, we would stay there again.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Usually Starwood is my favorite chain, but this Sheraton is a dud. Hotel staff were average... we had to ask several times for housekeeping to put a sheet on the bed (for some reason, all they kept putting on was a comforter and it wasn't always "clean", and we had to call four times for our mini-bar to be cleared out so we could use the fridge. The concierges were sometimes ok, but many times they kept telling us to ask one of the others that would be on site the next day (why hire concierges that don't know where things are?) and there was on that was less than competant. (Very disappointing.) The location was good... near Darling Harbor, so that was nice. The room was "clean-ish," but I just didn't get the feeling that it was well-kept. If you stay here, stay on the Harbor side, the view is worth it.
reviews.title: Not my favorite Sheraton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great. The room was modern, clean, and had a great view. Spend the extra few dollars to get the harbour view...it is worth it. The location is great for walking around Darling Harbour and is only a 15 minute walk to the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House! Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

description: Welcome to Australia’s largest hotel, Four Points by Sheraton Sydney, Darling Harbour with 683 rooms including 17 suites. Located in Sydney’s central business district overlooking Darling Harbour; you will find the major entertainment and shopping districts including Pitt Street Mall, Queen Victoria Building, and Chinatown in close proximity. Ideal for leisure travellers, the hotel offers contemporary dining and a 24-hour fitness centre. All rooms have been refurbished and offer modern furnishings, Wi-Fi internet access, comfortable beds and great views of the city or Darling Harbour.
